intro: Euphrasia × murbeckii, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its scientific name reflects its hybrid origin, combining species from Euphrasia, with "murbeckii" honoring the botanist who first described it. Euphrasia × murbeckii is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
